questions.text: Identify the disorder in the following ECG tracing:
questions.correct_answer: B. Mobitz type I AV block

Mobitz type II AV block The PR interval prolongs before the pause and intermittent failure of electrical impulse conduction from the atrium to the ventricle. The periodic failure of conduction in Mobitz type I block is characterized by a progressively lengthening PR interval, a shortening of the RR interval , and a pause that is less than two times the immediately preceding RR interval on the electrocardiogram (ECG).

questions.text: A patient was developing cardiac arrhythmia in the emergency department. When the ECG was taken he was found to have an absent p-wave and a progressive widening of the QRS complex. Which of the following is least helpful in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Intravenous calcium The patient's findings tell us that the patient is having arrhythmia along with the absent p wave, widening of QRS complex. This patient is having hyperkalemia Intravenous hco3 has no role in the treatment of hyperkalemia in emergency situation However it may slowly attenuate hyperkalemia with sustained administration over several hours

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option: A intravenous calcium Hyperkalemia here is very severe because of the cardiac manifestation. Hence it is an emergency situation Normally the treatment of hyperkalemia is divided into three phases in which the first phase consist of the immediate antagonism of the cardiac effects of the hyperkalaemia Hence intravenous calcium serves to protect the heart whereas other measures are taken to correct the hyperkalaemia Calcium raises the action potential threshold and reduces excitability without changing the resting membrane potential. Option: C insulin Insulin is used for the rapid reduction in plasma potassium concentration by redistribution into the cells. Hypoglycaemia is common with insulin hence they should be followed by an infusion of 10 percent dextrose at 50- 755ml per hour with close monitoring of plasma glucose concentration. Option: D diuretics Diuretics use in the third phase of treatment of hyperkalaemia. Diuretics are used in the removal of potassium.
